data.text:
Gerald Green has been a basketball fan since childhood but was unable to participate in the game until his second year. Today, he is popular to play with the Phoenix Suns and so far, he has achieved tremendous success in his professional basketball career and become one of the best NBA players to be seen with. to count. Here are more details about the famous NBA player.

Who is Gerald Green?

Born in Houston, Texas, United States, on the 26thfrom January 1986, Gerald Green is a professional basketball player for the National Basket Ball Association (NBA). He started playing in his sophomore year at Gulf Shores Academy High School in Houston, Texas when he joined junior college at J. Frank Dobie High School. He then transferred to Gulf Shores Academy for another year, after struggling with his previous high school. While at Golf Shore in his senior year, Green averaged 33 points, 12 rebounds, 7 assists, and 3 blocked shots per game. This made him the top scorer in the 2005 McDonald’s All-American Game. In the same year, the young player won the McDonald’s All-American Slam Dunk contest after defeating future Duke player Josh McRoberts. He then joined the famous NBA club Boston, the Celtics, and started playing for the team. In January 2006, he was selected by the Celtics for the NBA D-League. There he served two years and appeared in 32 games averaging 11.8 minutes, 5.2 points and 1.2 rebounds.

2007 was another successful year for Gerald Green who successfully won the NBA Slam Dunk Contest. That same year, he became a member of the Minnesota Timberwolves after passing 33 points in a game in Atlanta. However, in the second half, he was traded along with other professional basketball players such as Sebastian Telfair, Al Jefferson, Ryan Gomes and Theo Ratliff, for Minnesota Timberwolves’ Kevin Garnett. After playing for the Timberwolves for a year, Green was transferred to the Houston Rockets in February 2008 and then to Russia in 2009 where he played for the NBA’s away team.

2011 marked a fresh start for Green who returned to the United States and signed to play with the Los Angeles Lakers and D-Fenders for the NBA. A few months later he signed with the Indiana Pacers and in 2013 he was traded to the Phoenix Suns where he played for two years until 2015 when he signed on July 27 , 2016. He is currently signed to the Houston Rockets. He returned to the franchise for a second stint on December 28, 2017, during which Gerald Green was named the first player to score at least 7 3-pointers in consecutive games. That was after scoring 27 points in a 116-98 win over the Orlando Magic. One of the stars of the NBA, Geral Green’s net worth is estimated at $2 million.

What happened to his hand (finger)?

Gerald had an accident while still in his sixth year in high school. Wearing his mother’s class ring on his right ring finger, he attempted to get stuck in a makeshift hoop attached to a door. The ring got stuck on a nail which automatically tore her finger from the bone. The finger was eventually amputated in accordance with the doctor’s recommendation. Speaking about the incident and its impact on his personality, Green said he then had to deal with issues of insecurity, with co-workers in high school and throughout his career cracking jokes. He also revealed that he never wanted people to know, it made him feel like an outsider. However, the accident did not cause him to give up his basketball career. After being able to bear the pain and shame, Green returned to court with a bandaged hand and, although the amputated finger did not allow him to grab a bullet, he still tries to shoot as he continues to do until ‘until today..

Is Gerald Green married? wife and children

Both. The 3-foot-tall 2007 NBA Slam Dunk winner is not yet married, but he has two children, Geremiah and Julius, to whom he is deeply devoted. Although he hasn’t yet spoken about the mother of his two adorable children or even posted photos of her, it seems his girlfriend could be Dorislyn Martinez, often seen with the children. Green reportedly attended the 2014 Phoenix Suns charity event with her and the kids, but she currently lives in Dracut, Massachusetts.
